issue.title: [Bug]: DeepMap type behaves weirdly with arrays

issue.body:
### Version Number

7.14.0

### Codesandbox/Expo snack

https://codesandbox.io/s/fervent-lichterman-oopdi

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to provided codesandbox
2. Check type errors


### Expected behaviour

Honestly, I don't know how it should behave) but there is definitely something wrong with DeepMap type. 
https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?#code/CYUwxgNghgTiAEYD2A7AzgF3gEgHIkxGADUoIBXEALnnJQEsBHS+NATwFsAjJCAbgBQIAB4AHJDCyhIsBBjaiEuVAFUUoAGb0URADwAVAHzwAvPH3wRGEOrS11ILTuDwA--DFULhyBBoFwICADEqVdDYerYicubN6VBrLMAGL0U0AGXomFd7oQ7k5CVJepQak02j0iuVqph6TsSC4ACtwFh3IzmazzcqOVzjA8AAqwDD0MhJIPGGjKUMOJyRi0x612FCGiBE9Ms-pZ4o58u6qthxwRupRy1quz-GAwKDA7QaHzwFTGdxyoG6RdWuMa-3wCdT4HaisLjdw21Ee0VR3Oipuz3e1M7yfTsspQ8qY-qhPJsD33dP9uZlQexfQ9fwVXNdUDFIbkEAQBGQdApHoSQ2DdEAIAyGh-07LYhWsDg0BoHD6GAGglhQJp4GuGZrjaDFKB5XCQHwmhCiIkit0oto2JoOiEGuUprgEIA

P.S. It's broken since 7.13.0. Version 7.12.2 works fine

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

body:
hey @mlecoq I think for object value, we will have to use `NestedValue`, otherwise hook form couldn't differentiate if it's an object of inputs or object of value. I may need to revert the above PR. cc @kotarella1110 

https://react-hook-form.com/ts#NestedValue
